name: src/eventlistener.js
EventListener
description:
Class which functions as a wrapper which holds a defined listener {@link Function}.
This is done to ensure that when a listener {@link Function} is to be removed from and {@link EventTarget} the reference is the same as when it was added.

name: addTo
description: Binds the defined event-type and executor {@link Function} to the target.

params.name: target
params.description: {@link EventTarget} which should be listened to.

name: removeFrom
description: Removes the defined event-type and executor {@link Function} to the target.

params.name: target
params.description: {@link EventTarget} which should be listened to.

name: src/events/keydown.js
src/events/keyevent.js
src/events/keypress.js
src/events/keyup.js
src/index.js
src/keasy.js
when
description: Sets the eventType {@link String} this {@link Keasy} instance will capture.

params.name: eventType
params.description: This parameter is optional. If Keasy.when(eventType) is not passed an eventType it defaults to 'keydown'. Passing an eventType is advisable for readability purposes.

name: on
description: Binds an {@link EventTarget} to this {@link Keasy} instance.

params.name: eventTarget
params.description: The targeted {@link EventTarget} Keasy should target for {@link KeyBoardEvent}.

throws.description: If {@link Keasy.on} is not passed a valid {@link EventTarget} it will throw a {@link TypeError}.

name: then
description:
Binds a callback {@link Function} to this Keasy intsance.
Not calling {@link Keasy.then} means Keasy produces no output. Keasy still catches events of the type passed to {@link Keasy.when}.
Meaning you can call {@link Keasy.then} at another point in your code. See Example 3 for details.
examples:
<caption>Example 3</caption>
var keasy = Keasy.when(Keasy.down).on(document.getElementById('fancyId'));
document.getElementById('pretty').innerText = "Waiting is so boring..";
function delayedThen(){
     document.getElementById('pretty').innerText = "Ok I'm fed up with waiting.. For the love of God please type something!";
     keasy.then(function(){
         document.getElementById('pretty').innerText = "Thank you!!";
     });
};
window.setTimeout(delayedThen, 5000);

params.name: callback
params.description: The Function Keasy will call after it has caught a {@link KeyBoardEvent}.

throws.description: If Keasy.then(callback) is not passed a {@link Function} a {@link TypeError} is thrown.

name: after
description: Sets the amount of time and the unit of time this {@link Keasy} instance should wait until triggering the callback set in {@link Keasy.then}

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount of time Keasy waits until the {@link EventTarget} passed to {@link Keasy.on} stops firing {@link KeyBoardEvent}s.

params.name: unit
params.description: This parameter is optional. If  Keasy.after(amount,unit) is not passed a unit it defaults to milliseconds.

name: off
description: Removes the current listener from the {@link EventTarget} passed to {@link Keasy.on}.

name: is
description:
Binds a {@link String} representing a set of keys to this {@link Keasy} instance limiting when the callback {@link Function} passed to {@link Keasy.then} gets called.
The keys in the {String} that is passed should be divided by a "+" character.

throws.description: If {@link Keasy.is} is not passed a {String} a {@link TypeError} is thrown.

name: src/keymatcher.js
match
description: Sets a {String} of keys this instance of {@link KeyMatcher} should match for calls to {@link KeyMatcher.withEvent}.

name: withEvent
description: Matches the keys passed to {@link KeyMatcher.match} with the passed {@link KeyBoardEvent}.

params.name: event
params.description: A {@link KeyBoardEvent} the keys passed to {@link KeyMatcher.match} will be matched with.

params.name: event
params.description: A {@link KeyBoardEvent} this instance of {@link KeyMatcher} matches its keys to.
